result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Ann Stambaugh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa Ann Stambaugh is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa Ann Stambaugh was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500), Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

c: Def & Atty. eif
filed by ADA Amber Hahn regarding New Charges and resolving all cases. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Daniel J. Chapman, DF: Lisa Ann Stambaugh appeared.  Court called at 1:19 p.m.   Includes 13CF361, 14CF20, 14CF56, 14CF77, 14CF179 & 14CF230. DE files Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights with the court.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 in 13CF361 (drug paraphernalia) and in Ct. 2 in 14CF56 (retail theft).  In 14CF230 (bail jumping) court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing and binds over for trial.  DE enters Guilty plea on Ct. 1 14CF230.  Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 13CF361 (drug paraphernalia), Ct. 2 in 14CF56 (retail theft) and Ct. 1 in 14CF230 (bail jumping).   On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 14CF179, 14CF77 and 14CF20 and all other counts in 14CF361, 14CF56 and 14CF230.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 2 years probation with conditions and all counts concurrent.
-  AODA follow through with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Random drug testing.
- No contact with known drug users/dealers (this includes Katie McKusick and Lloyd Robl).
- 80 hours of community service.
- Court costs of $243 on 13CF361 and 13CF56 and $268 on 14CF230.  Apply bond and refund balance.


DE to report to probation today and bail bond continues until signed up. 
20 days to appeal
Filed by Atty Chapman. The Defendant wishes to change her plea. km

Address is confirmed and bond continues. sf  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, Rept. Kasten, Clerk: Feuerhelm, ADA: Amber Hahn, DF ATTY: Daniel Chapman, DF: Lisa Ann Stambaugh appeared.  Cases called at 1:32 p.m.  Includes Preliminary Hearing on 14CF56 and 14CF77.  Atty. Chapman presents waiver as to 14CF77.  Crt. advises Defendant of right to Preliminary Hearing on 14CF77, she understands.  Crt. finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily waived right to Preliminary Hearing and binds Defendant over for trial.  Crt. proceeds to Preliminary Hearing on 14CF56.  S/T NRPD Officer Westmoreland.  Direct by ADA Hahn.  Defendant identified.  Cross by Atty. Chapman.  ADA Hahn requests judicial notice of 13CF361 and bond, no objection.  Crt. takes judicial notice.  ADA Hahn and Atty. Chapman make arguments.  Crt. reviews Complaint and makes findings.  Crt. finds sufficient basis for probable cause and binds Defendant over for trial.  Crt. questions adminstratively transferring cases to EJL, no objection.  Crt. sets for Arraignment scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 09:30 am. kjf
